issue.title: std::promise synopsis shows two set_value_at_thread_exit()'s for no apparent reason

blockquote.pre: void set_value_at_thread_exit(const R& r); void set_value_at_thread_exit(see below);

discussion.p: While we are here, /p1 says that the specializations "differ only in the argument type of the member function set_value", which missed set_value_at_thread_exit.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4527.

li.p: Edit , class template promise synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.p: -1- The implementation shall provide the template promise and two specializations, promise<R&> and promise<void>. These differ only in the argument type of the member functions set_value and set_value_at_thread_exit, as set out in its descriptiontheir descriptions, below.
